item.title: Ticket #1471 (404s show the index page) updated
item.dc:creator: Leffe

item.title: Ticket #1577 (New Hook: future_post) updated
item.dc:creator: duck1123
item.description: publish_post should still be called either on the publish time, (if using psuedo-cron) or on the first pageview after the publish date. (This may be a problem for sites that get very little traffic.)

item.title: Ticket #1650 (Update SVN instructions on wordpress.org) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description: Disagreed. What would be the point of checking out the stable branch when a) they can just download it and b) it doesn't change much anyway? A notice should be placed on that page to the effect that they shouldn't run the bleeding edge code, but the link should still point to the trunk.

item.title: Ticket #1652 (Modify wp-admin blog address URI explanation text) created
item.dc:creator: stewart
item.description:
Switch from:

"If you want your blog homepage to be different than the directory you installed WordPress in, enter that address here."

to:

"If you want your blog homepage to be different than the directory you installed WordPress in, enter that address here. (Be sure to read <a href="​http://codex.wordpress.org/Moving_WordPress#Giving_WordPress_Its_Own_Directory"> Giving WordPress Its Own Directory</a> first.)"

This should hopefully cut down on the number of confused souls who don't realize they need to copy the index.php file from the WordPress root folder and then modify the file location of wp-blog-header.

item.title: Ticket #1651 (Provide 'modified' as an $allowed_key) created
item.dc:creator: kafkaesqui
item.description:
Along with posts columns such as 'date' and 'title', I'd like to see 'modified' made an $allowed_key for the orderby var on post queries. This interest obviously goes back, as someone created a wiki page on how to add it to the sort order options:

​http://wiki.wordpress.org/?pagename=HowToChangeSortOrder

And it's an occasional request on the support forums to have this. Would make a good replacement for 'category', which no longer works.

item.title: Ticket #1650 (Update SVN instructions on wordpress.org) created
item.dc:creator: stewart
item.description: Right now the instructions at ​http://wordpress.org/download/svn result in users getting the latest (aka unstable) build. Instead of checking out the trunk, they should check out the tag of the latest stable version.

item.title: Ticket #1649 (load_plugin_textdomain() doesn't work with plugin subdirs) closed
item.dc:creator: arnee
item.description:
duplicate:

Sorry, already reported and fixed: ​http://trac.wordpress.org/ticket/1468

item.title: Ticket #1649 (load_plugin_textdomain() doesn't work with plugin subdirs) created
item.dc:creator: arnee
item.description:
If you are running a plugin with custom language files and place it in its own subdirectory in the wp-content/plugin/ folder, language support will not work.

The function load_plugin_textdomain() (wp-l10n.php:89) tries to read the language file in the wp-content/plugin/ folder instead of wp-content/plugin/myplugin/.

item.title: Ticket #1648 (opml link won't work - syntax error) created
item.dc:creator: GrendelS
item.description:
take a look at

​http://www.iroke.de/wp/wp-links-opml.php or ​http://pastebin.com/353734 (error message source)

The opmlfile is not generated: XML Parsing Error: mismatched tag.

item.title: Ticket #739 (View by days doesn't work) updated
item.dc:creator: Podz
item.description:
I know this is an old one ...

If I want to show the last 7 days worth of posts, and set "Show at most:" to 7 days, then what is shown is te last 7 days on which I posted. This is not how I interpret "Show at most 7 days". I read that as "Show the last 7 days on a rolling basis". So if you come to my blog on 7 September, you will get shown what I posted from 1-7 inclusive and if there is nothing, you see nothing. Right now, if I have that 7 days and I happen to have posted once a month, you would actually see 7 months worth of posts.

Could we have some way of fixing a rolling period by time, not posts ?
